item.title: Highlighting services during closure
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
By default, the library already offers many services where the location of the user is not an obstacle. For example, we provide online access to many articles and ebooks. We also provide support and consultations via email, phone, or Zoom. In light of the lengthy buildings closure during the COVID-19 ...

Read moreHighlighting services during closure

item.title: User Research Results Part 2: Library News
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
News posts and newsletter content enable the library to share current happenings and to highlight and promote services. Our goal is to make these types of information discoverable in multiple places and whenever possible, put them into the path of the people who will find them most useful. Some users ...

item.title: User Research Results Part 1: Global Search and Site Search
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
Background In June and July 2020, the UX Team interviewed a representative set of users from the UCSF community as part of a larger user research initiative. Testing focused on learning more about users’ mental models and behaviors through common user testing methods. For a summary of findings see User ...

item.title: User Research Results Recap
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
In May, we announced that we would be user-testing the library website to see how easily it facilitates connection to materials, services, and expert help in several different areas. Using common testing methods, we split the research into two phases that took place in June and July. The first phase ...

item.title: 2020 Website Usability Testing
item.dc:creator: Anna VanderJagt
item.description:
In a sense, the website is the largest branch of the UCSF Library. More users interact with the library through our website than through our physical spaces, and this has been especially true during COVID-19 closures. Part of maintaining the quality of the website involves gathering user data and running ...

item.title: External Link Behavior Change
item.dc:creator: Richard Trott
item.description:
To improve website usability and accessibility, weâ€™re changing how external links open. The links will no longer open in a new window or tab by default. Right now, links to our own websites open within the same window (and tab), but external links open in a new window (or tab). ...

item.title: Home page Refresh
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
Back in April, we updated the menu on the main library website to include Ask an Expert. This was a move to highlight expertise and human-centered service, and it also aligns with some of the Library’s marquee projects around learning and service. As a result of integrating the experts content ...

item.title: Improved Help Center
item.dc:creator: Michele Mizejewski
item.description:
The Library uses Zendesk to manage support tickets submitted by users who have questions or need help. The Zendesk platform also includes a Help Center where we store answers to many common questions. This makes it easy to search and include a link when answering a ticket, or to just ...
